intro: Galium claytonii, commonly known as Clayton's bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pinkish flowers in late spring to early summer. Its flowers are typically surrounded by four to five narrow, leaf-like bracts. Galium claytonii thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
